name: Broad Bay House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights and had dinner on our first night. The food at breakfast and dinner was excellent and the service provided by Esther was faultless. BBH provides a very friendly and welcoming atmosphere and the lounge/dining area is a wonderful place to relax and watch the day go by. We'll be back.
reviews.title: Faultless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am afraid that I am not going to add anything other than more praise. Not just one of the best we have found in the Hebrides but probably in Scotland, and we are Scottish.
reviews.title: If Only They Were All Like This

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there during the Hebcelt Festival so they were not doing food in the evening, however the cooked breakfasts were superb. The rooms are very comfortable and well thought out and , as others say, packed with all the things you might need. The lounge has lovely views over the bay. The house was purpose built as a B & B and this is borne out in the well planned facilities - no compromises here living in someone's house.
reviews.title: Enjoy the luxury, forget the price...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The thing which also makes it stand out is that Ian and Marion judge their engagement with you so well. With us they were friendly and helpful but happy to leave you to enjoy the facilities. The staff similarly were well trained: charming an efficient. Esther is a local girl and a source of helpful information.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BBH together with the Spoons (Skye) have to be the best B&B’s in which we’ve stayed in the UK (to date). Luxury accommodation provided by very friendly hosts in a lovely location, just about everything that you could possibly want. Ok there’s a price to pay for this luxury but we thought it was worth it. Perhaps more small boutique hotel than your traditional b&b (that’s not a criticism merely an observation).
reviews.title: We will sure be back some day...
The place to stay on the Isle of Lewis
reviews.text: At the end of a 10 day driving tour of the Outer Hebrides from Barra to Lewis, we spent two wonderful nights at Broad Bay House and had a superb stay in every way. Ian and Marion were most gracious and friendly hosts, offering superb accommodation, unsurpassed hospitality and giving of their time to share with us their huge knowlege of this lovely island to make sure we maximised our enjoyment of what to see in 2 daysand leaving us wondering how soon we can come back! There is no doubt where we will stay next time (if they are not fully booked!). This must to the best place to stay on Lewis.

reviews.title: Stunning location- every detail have been thought of
reviews.text: We came to Broad Bay house as a treat and felt that it was well worth every penny. Everything is done to the highest standard and the overall feel is total relaxation and luxury whilst still feeling laid back and welcoming. What I didn't quite appreciate from the website is that the house is literally 30 seconds walk from the most stunning beach where you can see seals basking on the rocks nearby, and even on a sunny summer day we had the whole place to ourselves. The food was wonderful and we ate fantastic mussels and homemade ice cream. Thank you for a wonderful stay!!

reviews.title: Very high standards in all dimensions
reviews.text: The house was designed from scratch as a small, top of the range, hotel. The lounge/dining area has a "wow" factor in terms of comfort and views. Our room (3) is finished to a high standard with everything you could want. From the beginning Ian and Marion make you feel welcome and at home; they find out what you want and make sure you get it. Ideally stay for several days. In terms of food and drink: the cheese board was exceptional, and the breakfast scrambled egg with 3 types of smoked salmon was unique; wonderful wines. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. (Don't be put off by the places each side - the inside of Broad Bay is in a league of its own.)

reviews.title: Pure Bliss
reviews.text: After a recent visit to the Outer Hebrides, we ended in Lewis and what a perfect end to our wonderful week this being at Broad Bay House. I would truely recommend it to friends and family, though would like to keep this gem just all to ourselves. We were made to feel very much at home and both Ian and Marion were excellent hosts, along with Esther would was a treasure.

reviews.title: 80% wonderful
reviews.text: We will definitely be back and thank you for making a magical end to a magical week.

reviews.title: Hard to fault this small, modern hotel
reviews.text: It's hard to add much that hasn't been said already about Broad Bay House but take a look at our photos to get a feel for this special place. This is definitely the best small hotel we have stayed at - a stunning, beachfront location, outstanding hospitality and all the small things thought of which can make such a difference to a hotel stay (such as a comprehensive set of maps and guidebooks to borrow, free coffee in the room and lounge, free internet access, binoculars for watching the birds feeding in the bay, a good selection of CDs in the room and lounge and much more besides). As for the island of Lewis, it's not as mountainous as other parts of the Hebrides but it has a unique atmosphere and a fascinating history. We'll be back (to Back!).

reviews.title: The place to stay in Lewis
reviews.text: An immaculate small hotel in a beautiful location. The owner is obviously a gadget lover and the rooms have everything you could need. The dining room/lounge has superb sea views and the beach is just beyond the hotel gate - perfect for a stroll after breakfast or dinner. There is a great selection of books and CD's and you can download the full range of ordinance survey maps for the area if you want to take to the hills.

reviews.title: Best Hotel on Isle of Lewis
reviews.text: Unfortunately the hotel was not serving dinner on the night we stayed but the owner recommended a very good restaurant in Stornoway, which we thoroughly enjoyed. It would have been so much nicer, though, to have been able to dine at the hotel and enjoy the fabulous view. Hopefully we will do that next time as we have every intention of returning.

reviews.title: a great find of high quality
reviews.text: No more trawling for hotels on our next trip - we know where we will be heading!

reviews.title: wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: My wife I have recently returned from our secnd visit to this Hotel which confirmed our original impressions and whilst I do not normally write reviews I felt like many other guests I wanted to share my thoughts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have stayed in many fantastic places all over the world, and I have to say, Broad Bay House will always stay in my memory. Purpose-built, and wonderfully comfortable, with all the extra touches that you could want. On top of this, the exceptional hosts and staff make this such a fantastic place.
reviews.title: Why can't all hotels be like this??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you step into BBH, you can appreciate the attention to detail. I especially liked the wide and nicely lit hallway which led to the guest rooms and the oceanfront great room. And of course the great room/dining room, which is full of windows looking out on the waves and the flashing lighthouse over by Stornoway. What a great place to enjoy a lovely drink from the honors bar. Incredible.
reviews.title: Five star plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were also impressed by all the extra touches at BBH. A very nice guest laundry is available, and much appreciated after being on the road. Also, mainland UK phone calls are free if under 5 minutes. Such a nice courtesy. Abundant information about the local area is available in the small library area and in binders in the guest rooms. They also provide a printer and laptop in the library area if you need it. Honestly, there is nothing that is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Style, comfort and integrity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left very early on our last morning, and were provided sandwiches for the trip without even asking. And they were much appreciated. Thanks to everyone at BBH for making our trip to the Isle of Lewis so nice!
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Believe everything positive other reviewers have written. I couldn't fault this place, with so many thoughtful extras over and above what is a magnificent offering already - even to the extent of giving us bacon butties for breakfast when we arrived early to drop luggage off after coming in on the 8am plane. Outstanding. Don't book for just one night, as you will definitely regret it - two is the minimum!
reviews.title: Just beautiful!
Stay here if you're on Lewis
reviews.text: Beautiful setting, great hospitality and attention to detail, excellent food, nothing too much trouble.

reviews.title: No room service on the Sunday was a let down
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay with Ian and Marion, the breakfasts are wonderful, the house is modern with lots of gadgets and the setting overlooking Broad Bay is very relaxing..Ian and Marion make you feel very welcome but our only dissappointment was not getting the bed made or the towels changed on the Sunday, after all, we were on holiday!

reviews.title: A Fantastic Place to Stay
reviews.text: I can honestly say that Broad Bay House surpasses all of the boutique hotels we've stayed at in London! The whole place from the rooms, to the en-suites and the public areas is luxurious. The facilities are excellent and gadget lovers will be impressed by the quality of the electronics dotted around. There is even a computer and washer/dryer for guest use. If all of that isn't enough of a reason to stay here, the hosts (Ian and Marion) are very friendly and professional. The food is excellent and booking for dinner at Broad Bay is a must. We were going to split our trip to Harris and Lewis staying in two separate places but are so glad we decided to spend our full five days at Broad Bay. We will definitely be back and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

reviews.title: Room with a view
reviews.text: You won't get a much better view anywhere else. It's truly beautiful. What a pity someone's built their house RIGHT NEXT DOOR. It doesn't spoil the view too much though, and if you can get yourself into room 4 you won't see the neighbours at all!

reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful
reviews.text: How lovely to be able to relax in such a stylish yet cosy home. They've thought of everything: from super-cool hallway lighting to a magnificent telescope for seagull-spotting. There's even Molton Brown room spray! And the food was fantastic too. If only the wind had died down just for a second so we could have appreciated a G&T on our personal decking...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about Broad Bay House has been carefully thought out. There's a US adapter in the bedroom drawer; they have Assam tea bags in the room (!); the laundry is set up for the guests to use with the minimum of fuss; there are Ordnance Survey maps and books on suggested walks to borrow; Ian will lend you an extra camera; the food is first class; Esther admits to being wicked; and the kippers for breakfast are particularly delicious. What more can one ask for?
reviews.title: Extraordinary attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is only one word that comes to mind when thinking about our stay at Broad Bay House- Superb!
reviews.title: Summer Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This place has it all--- Excellent food, excellent rooms and luxurious bathrooms in a fabulous setting. You can relax on the deck or the beach or in the stunning sun room and watch the waves and wildlife in comfort with some excellent wine. This place was specifically built as a bed and breakfast and its shows with the attention to detail in the accommodations and the way it is run by Ian and Marion. Boarders are provided slippers, tea/coffee station in the rooms, and Molton Brown toiletries. Each room has wifi access and plasma television. Dinner is selected from an excellent menu and the full scottish breakfast is wonderful including home baked bread. Recipes are gladly provided so you can repeat the experience at home. It is a truly first class place. If you are traveling to Lewis this needs to be the place you stay.
reviews.title: fabulous place
A Haven within a Haven
reviews.text: How is it possible to add anything to the 100% positive comments in Trip Advisor. If any place was aiming at eliminating anything other than favourable comments it is Broad Bay House and succeeded admirably. Having been to many 5 and 4 star hotels in the last 12 months the bedroom in BBH would compete with these and more. Apart from being so tastefully presented it is the mass of personal touches that makes it special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guest lounge along with well stocked honesty bar make for a relaxing time on to of which there are spectacular views of the white sand beaches of the Isle of Lewis.
reviews.title: The little extras make this place really special... but mind the gap!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have travelled the world on business and pleasure and rarely if at all have I found an establishment that provides what really is 5* accomodation. From the initial welcome at the door to your departure you are made to feel welcome. The room was luxurious, the lounge and dining area are superbly located with wonderful views over the beach, and the food was "dreamy". Ian is certainly passionate about cooking and the menus he serves up are just excellent. Where would you feel at home enough to walk to breakfast in your sock feet!! We spent two days on the island and could have stayed longer. We will certainly be finding a reason to go back.
reviews.title: An oasis of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: .Myself and my wife had a fantastic stay. Ian and Marion were excellent hosts and we felt totally looked after. Our room was very comfortable and came complete with a whole range of snacks including biscuites, crisps and mints plus half a bottle of good wine. Room 2 has a wonderfull bath with room for 2. The view from the lounge was wonderful and both Lewis and Harris were well worth seeing. Ian put us in touch with a guide (Chris) who took us out for 2 of our 3 day stay. Ian himself took us out for the 3rd day. The guest house is very disabled friendly and they have one room suitable for a wheelchair user.
reviews.title: Stay longer than you planned and enjoy some of the best food you will ever eat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was among the best we have ever eaten, don't miss out on the kippers for breakfast or the scrambled egg and smoked samon. Ian provide a wide choice of evening meals varying from lamb, steak and venison to local samon. If it's on the menue the homemade raspberry ice cream is a must. They also provide a wonderful selection of cheese.
reviews.title: One of the most outstanding B+B's in the UK
Absolutely Perfect in "Every" Way , Can't Wait to Stay "Again and Again"
reviews.text: Overall having travelled all over the world this was one of the best places we have stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I don't usually take the time to write reviews (sorry!), however this place is one of the most outstanding places I have stayed in the UK. Compared to the 'next best' on Tripadvisor for the Western Isles, this place is of a different league, and compares to some of the best places I have stayed throughout the world. It is not super cheap, however the rooms are beautiful and there is enough electronic wizardry, maps and books subtly laid on to keep even those with advanced ADHD occupied! Not that you may need them: the view out of the communal lounge across the ocean is transfixing, and the kind and attentive hosts will ensure you have enough tea, coffee (10 types!) and even a complimentary half a bottle of wine to keep you going. Food is also magnificent, but you get the idea. I loved this place, and suggest you go. Period.
reviews.title: Change Your Plans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't really add much to the reviews that have been posted already. This is definitely the best B&B I have stayed in. Ian and Marion are excellent hosts. The warmth of the welcome, high level of service and the amenities provided combined with view from the stunning lounge/dining room made our visit quite memorable. We ate on two evenings and the quality of the food was excellent, as was breakfast. Ian gave us useful suggestions for trips and where to eat en route and the ready supply of maps was much appreciated. We will be back.
reviews.title: More than a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners of Broad Bay house have a wonderful eye for detail and guest comfort.
reviews.title: B & B with 'wow' factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The amenity provided is exceptional. Yes, the location is some distance from town, but this is of little consequence when compared with the luxurious facilities on offer, and a wonderful seaside vista. We dined at BBH by prior arrangement and the meal was truly memorable.
reviews.title: My 70th Birthday with my wife and my 2 children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every consideration has been given to make the visitor experience first class.
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor, the in- room guest provisions, the entertainment equipment and other unexpected 'comforts' are delightful. Broad Bay House rates as one of the very best establishments of its kind.
reviews.title: Perfect

aka: Broad Bay House Hotel Isle Of Lewis
description: Outstanding beach side contemporary guesthouse, rated 5 Star Gold and Eat Scotland Silver by Visit Scotland. Spacious luxury bedrooms, amazing views, fine food and a great selections of wines and whiskeys. Free wi-fi, fully equipped guest library with PC and printer, free bike loan and a completely relaxing environment. Just 10 minutes from Stornoway, and ideally situated for exploring the Isle of Lewis and Harris.
